definitions.definition: on or to the further side of something

examples.text: The road continues beyond the village up into the hills.
Our success was far beyond what we thought possible.
She's got nothing beyond her state pension.
It won't go on beyond midnight.
I know what I'll be doing for the next three weeks but I haven't thought beyond that.

definitions.definition: used to say that something is not possible

examples.text: The bicycle was beyond repair *(= is too badly damaged to repair)*.
The situation is beyond our control.

definitions.definition: too far or too advanced for somebody/something

examples.text: The handle was just beyond my reach.
The exercise was beyond the abilities of most of the class.

definitions.definition: to be impossible for somebody to imagine, understand or do

examples.text: It's beyond me why she wants to marry Jeff.

wordOrigin: Old English begeondan, from be ‘by’ + geondan of Germanic origin (related to yon and yonder).
